Introduction
My research focus on plant evolution, systematics and evolutionary biogeography, emphasizing tropical ferns and lycophytes. I am interested in using evolutionary tools and approaches to undeto understand the diversification and distribution of tropical lineages, and use integrative approaches to better circumscribe and describe the biodiversity. I am currently a Professor of Botany at Universidade Federal do Oeste do Pará, Central Amazon, Brazil.

We describe a new species of Microgramma (M. microsoroides) from the Atlantic Forest of Brazil, present a phylogeny of Microgramma, and provide a new generic circumscription. Microgramma comprises ca. 30 species in the Neotropics and perhaps two species in Africa and on islands in the Indian Ocean. Several species are contentious with regard to gen...

Project
To address knowledge gaps in the Amazonian Flora, focusing in inadequately sampled areas, seeking integrative approaches, and trying to strengthen the botanical research in the Amazon region

Pteridophyte Symposium 2020 - Ferns in focus
Project
Fern and lycophyte specialists from across the entire world will have again the opportunity to discuss new advances in the study of these groups. This time Brazil, a country known for its incredible biodiversity, will receive hundreds of scientists at a time when global challenges make these meetings more necessary than ever. For more details, visit our website: https://www.fernsinfocus2020.com

Systematics of the fern genus Microgramma C.Presl (Polypodiaceae)
Project
This project aims to: 1) Use systematic tools to understand the relationships within the fern genus Microgramma (Polypodiaceae); 2) Investigate the biogeographic history underlying the current geographic distribution of the genus; 3) Monograph the genus Microgramma.
